_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Nova Molecular Sumter, LLC owns and operates a chemical storage and distribution facility at 249 South Harvin Street, Sumter, SC. Chemicals are generally received by, and shipped from, the facility via tank truck, box truck, and railcar.



(a) The facility is committed to the safety of its employees and neighboring community. Facility personnel receive training relevant to preventing hazards and emergency response as provided in the facility's emergency response plan. Topics discussed to prevent hazards include: site access, inspections, location and operation of emergency response equipment, utilization of existing safety measures (e.g., berms, containment), and the handling of recovered materials in the event of a release. Facility personnel are trained to respond to incipient fires and spills.  However, the Sumter Fire Department is the primary responder in the event of a release beyond the incipient stage.



(b) The facility consists of a chemical tank farm and drum processing building. The Tank Farm consists of twenty six above-ground storage tanks ranging in capacity from 10,000 to 30,000 gallons.  The regulated substance potentially handled above

their regulated threshold levels in the Tank Farm process is hydrogen cyanide at 1.5% of a solvent solution. No regulated substances are managed above their threshold levels in the drum processing building.



(c) The facility has determined that it is subject to the Program Level 3 requirements of the RMP regulations and is also subject to the OSHA PSM Standards at 29 CFR Part 1910.119. As such, Nova has implemented a Level 3 Prevention Program required at 40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D.  The objective of the accident prevention program is to develop a proactive approach to the identification, evaluation, and prevention of chemical releases. Nova strives to meet these objectives through the implementation of the PSM and RMP programs. The key elements of these programs are: 



1. Employee participation

2. Process safe

ty information

3. Process hazard analysis

4. Operating procedures

5. Training

6. Contractor safety

7. Pre-startup safety reviews

8. Mechanical integrity program

9. Hot work permitting

10. Management of change

11. Incident investigations

12. Emergency response plans

13. Compliance audits



(d) The facility has not experienced an accident with off-site impacts meeting the criteria at 40 CFR Part 68.10(g)(1) during the past five years.



(e) Nova has developed and implemented an emergency response plan under the Program Level 3 RMP requirements. The Emergency Response Plan provides detailed response, notification, reporting, and evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency situation at the facility and consists of the main elements of the RMP Emergency Response Plan requirements.  Emergency response training includes: notification of appropriate personnel (company and off-site responders); hazardous material identification; release assessment; control procedures; prevention of recurrence or spread of fires/releases; and incident clean-up. The facility maintains emergency equipment to use in the event or a fire or release (e.g., personal protective equipment (PPE), spill control equipment).  The Sumter County Emergency Management Office, Sumter Fire Department, City of Sumter Police Department, Sumter County Sheriff's Department, and Prisma Health Tuomey Hospital are part of the emergency response plan for the facility and have been provided copies of the facility's contingency plan. 



Facility personnel are trained to respond to incipient fires and releases. The facility has coordinated it response activities with the local response agencies and these agencies, along with private contractors may be notified in the event of larger fires and/or releases.



(f) The facility provides refresher employee training regularly that incorporates safe handling practices, hazard prevention, and emergency response. The facility also performs monthly safety meet

ings on various topics taken from suggestions provided by facility employees to improve general site safety and RMP-constituent safety procedures. With respect to the handling of RMP chemicals not included in this registration, Nova will attempt to actively manage the processing of these chemicals such that the volume of the chemicals is below the RMP threshold quantities.
